caption.paragraph:
Figs 14–19. Comparison of male genitalia of
H. axyridis (Pallas, 1773)
(14–16) and
H. quadripunctata ( Pontoppidan, 1763 )
(17–19): 14, 17 – tegmen; 15, 18 – penis; 16, 19 – penis apex. All in lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
In Iran,
H. quadripunctata
was first reportedfrom North Khorasan Province in 2013 ( BIRANVAND et al. 2017 ). It was subsequently reported from Mazandaran Province, in northern Iran (
PAHLAVAN YALI et al. 2017
). Here, wepresent the first report from Semnan Province.
